# 10.34515/DATA.C14-00001 https://www.isee.nagoya-u.ac.jp/doi/10.34515/DATA_C14-00001.html
Carbon-14 Data: a single-year cosmic ray event at 5410 BCE
cosmic ray event at 5410 BCE carbon-14 tree rings cosmogenic nuclide
Miyake Fusa
Institute for Space-Earth Environmental Research, Nagoya University, Japan
https://orcid.org/0000-0001-8002-9601
Wacker Lukas
Laboratofy for Ion Beam Physics, ETH Zürich, Switzerland

Institute for Space-Earth Environmental Research, Nagoya University
The initial release V01
10.1029/2021GL093419
en
2021-05-01 (version: v01)
14C concentrations of wood specimens measured by Accelerator Mass Spectrometry (AMS)
Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International license (CC BY-NC 4.0)
Information of wood specimens for the California, Finlnad, and Switzerland series: (1) Pinus longaeva specimen 1971#059 from the Methuselah Walk site in the White Mountains of California, U.S. (37.3794°N, 118.1654°W, 3094 a.s.l.), (2) Pinus sylvestris specimen from Finnish Lapland (69.26°N, 27.40°E, 199 a.s.l.), and (3) Larix decidua Mill. specimen from the forefield of the Unteraar glacier, Switzerland (46°34’ N, 8°15’ E, 1930 m a.s.l.). The 14C concentrations in the California, Finnish, and Switzerland specimens were measured at ETH Zürich and Yamagata University (YU-AMS), at YU-AMS, and at ETH Zürich, respectively.
Miyake, F. and L. Wacker, Carbon-14 Data: a single-year cosmic ray event at 5410 BCE, DOI:10.34515/DATA.C14-00001, 2021.
2021-05-01
